data.title: Extensions UI Should Have Some Sort of Text/Indicator When No Results Are Returned
data.body:
- VSCode Version: VS Insiders 1.6

In the extensions UI, when no results are found, there should be text or something that indicates this. Currently, the pane is just empty:

![screen shot 2016-09-28 at 11 47 35 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18927580/5cd3134c-8571-11e6-87cb-9e526221764e.png)

To me, with the empty pane makes it unclear if something went wrong or if search results are still being returned or what.

This shows up both when searching for a new extension to install (as shown above) and when viewing the list of installed or outdated extensions:

![screen shot 2016-09-28 at 11 48 35 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18927629/867f9f08-8571-11e6-9373-a7715adbe62e.png)

Find on the other hand shows some info when no results are returned: 

![screen shot 2016-09-28 at 11 49 32 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18927659/a6918bc6-8571-11e6-8db5-bf1f1d8fb6d9.png)

data.title: Send feedback dialog doesn't provide correct affordances
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12519

Hyperlinks should be underlined when hovering in Other ways to contact us box
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18927353/6751c2b0-8570-11e6-977f-05eb153d7949.png)

Wrong cursor when hovering over tweet button, and also button should look depressed (physically, not emotionally)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18927393/8ee48d44-8570-11e6-8b6e-a894ebfe8a6f.png)

Similar to #12847, the selection cursor is appearing for unselectable text 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18927575/56518bb6-8571-11e6-876d-eae138819929.png)

Additionally, we should consider outlining the dialog itself to better differentiate from the background
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18927480/0749d168-8571-11e6-8a06-83e47afa506f.png)

data.title: Allow user to pick multiple options from showQuickPick list
data.body: I am making an extension for VSCode where I present the user with a list using `showQuickPick()` like so: From what I understand, this way allows user to only pick one item out of the whole list. Is there a way to allow user to pick multiple items? I could not find anything for this on the [vscode namespace API](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api).

data.title: Extension Search Default Query Should Have Space After It
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 Insiders
- OS Version: OSX 10.11
##### Steps to Reproduce
1. In new VS session, click on extensions section
2. Start typing some search term.
##### Expected

Entered text  becomes search term
#### Actual

Because no space in inserted after the default `@sort:installs` query, the text is tacked onto the end of that:

![sep-28-2016 11-28-47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18927026/d8b81b22-856e-11e6-8864-da2991f23241.gif)

data.title: Renaming an open file is jarring

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12519

See video below:
[2016-09-28_11-04-54.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/498920/2016-09-28_11-04-54.zip)

While renaming the file aa.php to aaa.php, the following happens within the course of a second:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18926654/82a40602-856d-11e6-9dc9-eb0779136027.png)
- **Frame 1:** Starting point
- **Frame 2:** aa.php gets renamed to aaa.php in file viewlet, and aa.php becomes unselected (but not removed) in Open Editors view
- **Frame 3:** All of the files in the open editors view shift down by one file "unit", as aaa.php gets added and highlighted to the open editors view, but aa.php isn't removed. Additionally, there is some additional padding that gets added between the open editors view and the file view. 
- **Frame 4:** aa.php gets removed from the open editors view and all of the files below it are subsequently shifted upwards in the Open Editor view.
- **Frame 5:** the extraneous padding between the Open Editors and File view gets removed

All of this occurs within a timeframe that's very much perceptible to the user and gives the impression that the app isn't "smooth". I don't know if this has to do with the recent electron update, but I do notice that v1.5 doesn't seem to feel as jarring, though haven't dug into it as much.

data.title: Windows Debugger breaks on lowercase filename

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Create an .exe that uses mixed case filenames. i.e. Source.cpp
2. Add a breakpoint to Source.cpp
3. Debug and hit the breakpoint

The editor will open up source.cpp alongside Source.cpp. The arrow pointing to the current line is in source.cpp, the breakpoints are in Source.cpp. It's pretty confusing. Both files can have their own sets of breakpoints now.

data.title: Error Installing Test-extension-pack-2 on Windows
data.body:
From #12647 
- VSCode Version: 1.6 Insiders
- OS Version: Win 10
##### Steps to Reproduce
1. Without any extensions installed, try to install `test-extension-pack-2`
2. Select "Yes" for installing dependencies 
##### Actual

I see this error message, and none of the extensions are installed

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18926241/e2bac6f4-856b-11e6-8d22-514164eb16d5.png)

This file does not exist on disk. There is a `C:\Users\matb.REDMOND\.vscode-insiders\extensions\designbright.theme-suicidesquad-0.1.0\.vscode` directory but it is empty.

If I manually install `designbright.theme-suicidesquad` before installing pack-2, the installation works.

data.title: Info prompt to restart Code after uninstalling extension, but not installing

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Publish an extension with dependency `foo`
2. Install the extension, prompt
3. Publish new version of the extension with additional dependency `bar`
4. Install the extension, no prompt

data.title: Workspace or Folder or both?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 insiders
- OS Version: any

The Go menu contains `Go to Symbol in Workspace`.  With #12911 the command palette would contain: 
- Go to Symbol in Workspace
- Configure Workspace Recommended Extension
- Show Workspace Recommended Extension
- Open Workspace Settings

We also experimented with "Configure Workspace". However, anywhere else we use "folder", i.e. we don't really have an explicit concept of workspace.

data.title: Menubar and Context Menu invisible on Windows High Contrast
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.5.3 - OS Version: Win 10 Education 10.0.14393 Build 14393 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Set Windows to high contrast mode with dark background 2. Start VS Code and open menu bar or context menu The result is that the menu items are invisible (white on white, see picture), only the selected item remains visible.

data.title: vsce should not publish with duplicates in extensionDependencies
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (c94c824db64a88bd4909da2e84e44316dbf8e8fb, 2016-09-28T06:23:37.103Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12647

Extensions can be published like the following:

``` js
    "extensionDependencies": [
        "Tyriar.sort-lines",
        "Tyriar.lorem-ipsum",
        "Tyriar.lorem-ipsum"
    ]
```

data.title: Command Palette should show "Go to Symbol in File" and "Go to Symbol in Workspace"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 insiders
- OS Version: any

With #11494 the Go menu now includes `Go to Symbol in File` and `Go to Symbol in Workspace`. The command palette only includes `Go to Symbol` which is `Go to Symbol in File`. There is no command for `Go to Symbol in Workspace`. We should add the command and make sure they are called the same in the command palette and the Go menu.

data.title: Let me refresh the extension list in a reliable way

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (c94c824db64a88bd4909da2e84e44316dbf8e8fb, 2016-09-28T06:23:37.103Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12647

It seems very random sometimes when I get informed there is an update to an extension. Sometimes it takes 10+ minutes to get an update, sometimes it's unclear whether I have the updated version and the version string in the viewlet is lying to me.

A refresh button next to the viewlet title or in the overflow would be useful.

data.title: Should extensionDependencies be tied more closely to their parent extension?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (c94c824db64a88bd4909da2e84e44316dbf8e8fb, 2016-09-28T06:23:37.103Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12647

Related: #12906

Perhaps this was a design decision but how I was envisioning this working was that installing an extension `foo` that depended on `bar`. Would result in something like this in the extension viewlet:
- ext a [Uninstall]
- foo [Uninstall]
  - bar [Detach from foo/promote] [Uninstall]
- ext b [Uninstall]

Then uninstalling `foo` would also uninstall `bar`.

data.title: Extensions publish do not warn/error on invalid extensionDependencies

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (c94c824db64a88bd4909da2e84e44316dbf8e8fb, 2016-09-28T06:23:37.103Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12647

I published an extension without errors with the following extensionDependencies:

``` js
    "extensionDependencies": [
        "Tyriar.sort-lines@1.0.0",
        "Tyriar.lorem-ipsum"
    ]
```

It published fine but when installed it only installs `Tyriar.lorem-ipsum`.

data.title: extensionDependencies should support @x.y.z annotation in addition to ^ and ~ as in dependencies
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (c94c824db64a88bd4909da2e84e44316dbf8e8fb, 2016-09-28T06:23:37.103Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12647

Extension authors will use `extensionDependencies` for more than just packs but to rely on the contributions an extension exposes. That means that it becomes important when API breakages occur. An example of this is an extension that uses `registerTextDocumentContentProvider` could be depended upon by another to utilize its `TextDocumentContentProvider`.

data.title: C# (powered by OmniShar) Extension
data.body:
Hello,

Not sure the right place to report, but couldn't figure out better...

Any case... When opening a C# project (folder) - after installing the extension - OmniSharp installed in the background. Everything seems perfect, but the OmniSharp installation is useless as it installs a 64 bit version, that can not be run on this machine!!!

> Installing OmniSharp to C:\Users\peter.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1\out.omnisharp-coreclr
>     Attempting to download omnisharp-1.9-beta14-**win-x64**-netcoreapp1.0.zip
>     Downloading to C:\Users\peter\AppData\Local\Temp\tmp-2768LYlP6LMQhvgw.tmp...
>     Download complete!
>     Decompressing...
>     Done! 441 files unpacked.
> 
> Starting OmniSharp server at 28.9.2016, 20:04:57
>     Target: c:\Users\peter\Documents\VSCode\ASPTest
> 
> OmniSharp server started
>     Path: C:\Users\peter.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1\out.omnisharp-coreclr\OmniSharp.exe
>     PID: 2916
> 
> This version of C:\Users\peter.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1\out.omnisharp-coreclr\OmniSharp.exe is not compatible with the version of Windows you're running. Check your computer's system information to see whether you need a x86 (32-bit) or x64 (64-bit) version of the program, and then contact the software publisher.
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win 7 - 32 bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VSCode 1.5.3 on win 7 - 32 bit
2. Install extension for C#
3. Open the output pane
4. Open a C# project (folder)
5. See what on the output pane

data.title: Details of extension dependencies should show up in details or contributions tab
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (c94c824db64a88bd4909da2e84e44316dbf8e8fb, 2016-09-28T06:23:37.103Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
#12647

Publishing an extension with extension dependencies does not show the dependencies anywhere, meaning an "empty" extension with 100 dependencies could exist and radically change the environment without warning the user.

data.title: watermark changes
data.body: These are the changes described in #12899.

data.title: Improve layout and typography of the Getting-Started watermark
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 insiders
- OS Version: MacOS

See the following screenshot:
![screen shot 2016-09-28 at 08 56 25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4674940/18921450/aba20a7c-8559-11e6-9967-6ec3011c3cbb.png)
1. The blue boxes should be vertically centerline aligned.
2. The bold font is too dense and hard to read particularly as the contrast between the foreground and the background color is muted and thus the text looks blurred. Setting the font-weight to normal and using `letter-spacing` of around `0.04em` improves readability.
3. The keyboard shortcuts on the right are then still hard to parse. Putting them in a  `span` and using a `letter-spacing` of `0.15em` (or `0.1em`) and a left and right padding of `0.5em` improves this.

This is what it looks like with  the changes proposed in 2. and 3.
![screen shot 2016-09-28 at 9 46 35 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4674940/18923281/899a8d26-8560-11e6-99be-28c80c581318.png)

data.title: Bug: TextEditor.insert() fails to update TextEditor.selections
